question_text: Has the establishment obtained a valid electronic Certificate of Registration from the registering officer?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments with 10 or more workers (or as notified for hazardous activities).
legal_text: Every employer of any establishment... shall, within sixty days from the date of such applicability of this Code, make an application electronically to the registering officer... for the registration of such establishment. The registering officer shall register the establishment and issue a certificate of registration electronically.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the electronic Certificate of Registration.
Step 2: Verify that the name and address of the establishment match the current location.
Step 3: Check if the certificate is generated within the correct timeline (60 days of applicability).

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the full PDF or clear image of the Registration Certificate issued by the Ministry/Department of Labour.
capture_instructions.title: Registration Certificate

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the uploaded document is an 'Establishment Registration Certificate' or 'Form 1'. Reject if irrelevant.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract the 'Establishment Name', 'Registration Date', and 'Max Number of Employees'. Verify if the date is visible and valid.

question_text: Have any changes in ownership, management, or particulars been intimately electronically to the registering officer within 30 days?
applicability_criteria: Applicable if there have been changes in ownership/management after initial registration.
legal_text: Any change in the ownership or management or in any particulars... which occurs after the registration of an establishment... shall be intimated by the employer electronically to the registering officer within thirty days of such change.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Ask if there were any recent changes in Directors, Partners, or Occupiers.
Step 2: If yes, request the electronic intimation receipt or amended Registration Certificate.
Step 3: Verify the date of intimation is within 30 days of the change.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload proof of intimation for change in particulars or the updated Registration Certificate.
capture_instructions.title: Change Intimation Proof

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Notice of Change' or 'Amended Registration Certificate'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Date of Change' and 'Date of Intimation'. Verify if the difference is <= 30 days.

question_text: Has the employer submitted the Notice of Commencement of Operation to the appropriate authority?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Factories, Mines, Contract Labour, and Construction establishments.
legal_text: No employer of an establishment being factory or mine or relating to contract labour or building or other construction work shall use such establishment to commence the operation... without sending notice of such purpose in such form and manner... as may be prescribed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the Notice of Commencement (often Form 4-A or similar depending on state rules).
Step 2: Verify that it was submitted electronically.
Step 3: Confirm it covers the specific industry type (Factory/Mine/etc).

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the electronic receipt or copy of the Notice of Commencement submitted to the authority.
capture_instructions.title: Commencement Notice

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Notice of Commencement of Operation'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Date of Commencement' and 'Submission Date'. Confirm the document is addressed to the correct authority.

question_text: Does the employer issue a formal appointment letter to every employee containing prescribed information?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Issue a letter of appointment to every employee on his appointment in the establishment, with such information and in such form as may be prescribed... and where an employee has not been issued such appointment letter... he shall, within three months... be issued such appointment letter.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Select 3 random employee files.
Step 2: Check for the presence of an Appointment Letter signed by the employer.
Step 3: Ensure it contains wage details, designation, and terms of employment.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload one anonymized or sample appointment letter currently in use.
capture_instructions.title: Appointment Letter Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the document looks like an 'Appointment Letter' or 'Employment Contract'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Verify presence of 'Employee Name', 'Designation', 'Wages/Salary', and 'Employer Signature'.

question_text: Does the employer provide free annual health examinations to eligible employees?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments with employees of prescribed age/class (typically hazardous industries or older workers).
legal_text: Provide such annual health examination or test free of costs to such employees of such age or such class of employees of establishments... as may be prescribed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the Annual Health Check-up policy or recent records.
Step 2: Verify that the cost is borne by the employer (not deducted from wages).
Step 3: Check records for employees above the prescribed age threshold (often 45+).

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a summary report of health checkups or an invoice from the medical provider proving employer payment.
capture_instructions.title: Health Check Compliance

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Medical Checkup Report', 'Health Camp Invoice' or 'Health Policy'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Scan for keywords like 'Annual Health Check', 'Free of Cost', or payment details indicating employer liability.

question_text: Is the workplace visibly free from hazards likely to cause injury or occupational disease?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Ensure that workplace is free from hazards which cause or are likely to cause injury or occupational disease to the employees.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Walk through the main production or work areas.
Step 2: Look for exposed wiring, blocked exits, slippery floors, or unguarded machinery.
Step 3: Observe if workers are wearing necessary PPE.

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the general work floor showing clear aisles and safe conditions, or a photo of a specific hazard if found.
capture_instructions.title: Workplace Safety Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if image shows a workplace environment (factory floor, office, construction site).
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Analyze image for obvious hazards like 'fire', 'blocked path', 'spill', or 'exposed wires'. (Experimental)

question_text: If applicable, does the establishment hold a valid Common License for Factory, Contract Labour, and Beedi work?
applicability_criteria: Applicable if the employer has opted for a single license under Section 119.
legal_text: Any person desirous of obtaining common licence in respect of a factory, industrial premises for beedi and cigar work and for engaging contract workers... shall make an application electronically... such authority shall issue a licence.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Ask if the unit operates under a Common License scheme.
Step 2: If yes, verify the single license covers all relevant activities (Factory + CL).
Step 3: Check validity (5 years typically).
Step 4: If no, ensure separate licenses are available.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the Common License if availed, otherwise skip or upload individual licenses.
capture_instructions.title: Common License Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Common License' or 'Unified License'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Valid From', 'Valid Till', and 'Activities Covered' (Factory, Contract Labour).

question_text: Does the establishment strictly adhere to the 8-hour daily working limit?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: No worker shall be required or allowed to work, in any establishment or class of establishment for more than eight hours in a day.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the Muster Roll or Attendance Register for the last month.
Step 2: Select a sample of 5 workers.
Step 3: Check their 'Time In' and 'Time Out' entries to ensure the working duration (excluding breaks) does not exceed 8 hours.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a clear image of the attendance register page showing daily hours for a random week.
capture_instructions.title: Daily Hours Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the document is an 'Attendance Register' or 'Time Sheet'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Time In', 'Time Out', and 'Break Duration'. Calculate total working hours. Flag if any entry > 8 hours.

question_text: Is every worker allowed a weekly holiday (day of rest)?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: No worker shall be allowed to work in an establishment for more than six days in any one week.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Review the Shift Schedule or Attendance Register.
Step 2: Verify that every worker has at least one 'Off' or 'Rest' day marked in every 7-day cycle.
Step 3: If a worker worked on a rest day, check if a compensatory holiday was given.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the shift roster or attendance log showing weekly off days.
capture_instructions.title: Weekly Holiday Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the document is a 'Shift Schedule' or 'Attendance Log'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Analyze the sequence of 'Present' days. Flag if any worker has > 6 consecutive working days without a 'Rest' marker.

question_text: Are workers paid overtime wages at double the normal rate for extra work?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments where overtime work is performed.
legal_text: There shall be paid wages at the rate of twice the rate of wages in respect of overtime work, where a worker works... for more than such hours of work in any day or in any week.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Identify workers who worked overtime from the Attendance Register.
Step 2: Request the 'Register of Overtime' or Wage Slip for those workers.
Step 3: Compare the 'OT Rate' with the 'Normal Hourly Rate'. It must be exactly 2x.
Step 4: Ensure OT hours are calculated daily or weekly (whichever is more beneficial).

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the Overtime Register or a Wage Slip showing OT calculation.
capture_instructions.title: Overtime Payment Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is an 'Overtime Register' or 'Wage Slip'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Normal Rate', 'Overtime Rate', and 'OT Hours'. Verify if Overtime Rate == 2 * Normal Rate.

question_text: For night shifts extending beyond midnight, is the 24-hour rest period correctly calculated?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments with night shifts.
legal_text: Where a worker... works on a shift which extends beyond midnight... a weekly holiday for a whole day shall mean in his case a period of twenty-four consecutive hours beginning when his shift ends.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Identify night shift workers (e.g., Shift C: 10 PM - 6 AM).
Step 2: Check the 'Weekly Off' timing.
Step 3: Ensure the next shift does not start until 24 hours after the night shift ended.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the roster for night shift workers showing shift end times and next shift start times.
capture_instructions.title: Night Shift Rest Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Shift Roster'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Identify 'Shift End Time' on the day before the holiday. Verify the next 'Shift Start Time' is >= 24 hours later.

question_text: Is the system of overlapping shifts prohibited (except for Mines)?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments except Mines (Section 29(1) [cite: 777]).
legal_text: The work shall not be carried on in any establishment by means of a system of shifts so arranged that more than one relay of workers is engaged in work of the same kind at the same time.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Review the shift schedule.
Step 2: Check if Shift A and Shift B overlap (e.g., A: 6AM-2PM, B: 1PM-9PM).
Step 3: If overlap exists, ask for a specific exemption order from the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the Shift Schedule. If overlaps exist, upload the Exemption Order.
capture_instructions.title: Shift Overlap Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Shift Schedule' or 'Exemption Order'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Analyze shift timings. Detect overlaps. If overlap found, flag for manual review unless 'Exemption' keyword is present.

question_text: Is double employment restricted (no work in two establishments within 12 hours)?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Factories and Mines.
legal_text: No worker shall be required or allowed to work in a mine or factory if he has already been working in any other such similar establishment within the preceding twelve hours.

inspection_steps: Step 1: This is difficult to verify directly.
Step 2: Check for any shared workers with nearby sister concerns.
Step 3: Verify shift timings do not conflict/overlap between the two units.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a policy document or worker declaration form where they state they are not employed elsewhere.
capture_instructions.title: Double Employment Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Declaration' or 'HR Policy'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Scan for clause prohibiting 'Dual Employment' or 'Double Work' within 12 hours.

question_text: Is the Notice of Periods of Work displayed correctly?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: There shall be displayed and correctly maintained in every establishment a notice of periods of work, showing clearly for every day the periods during which workers may be required to work.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Go to the main notice board.
Step 2: Look for 'Form 13' (or state equivalent) showing shift start/end times and rest intervals.
Step 3: Verify it is legible and up-to-date.

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the Notice Board showing the 'Notice of Periods of Work'.
capture_instructions.title: Notice Board Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if image contains a table with 'Shift', 'Time', 'Rest Interval'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Verify if the notice includes 'Start Time', 'End Time', and 'Break Duration'.

question_text: Are compensatory holidays granted within 2 months if a worker works on a weekly holiday?
applicability_criteria: Applicable when workers are deprived of weekly holidays due to exemption.
legal_text: The worker shall be allowed, within the month in which the holidays were due or within the two months immediately following that month, compensatory holidays of equal number to the holidays, so deprived.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Identify workers who worked on their rest day (from Attendance Register).
Step 2: Check the 'Compensatory Holiday Register' (Form 15 equivalent).
Step 3: Verify the compensatory off was taken within 2 months.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the register showing work on rest days and subsequent compensatory offs.
capture_instructions.title: Compensatory Off Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Compensatory Holiday Register'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: For every 'Work on Holiday' entry, find the corresponding 'Compensatory Off' date. Verify difference is <= 60 days.

question_text: Has a Safety Committee been constituted with equal representation of workers and employers?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Factories/Construction (>250 workers), Mines (>100 workers), or as notified.
legal_text: Require any establishment... to constitute in the prescribed manner a Safety Committee consisting of representatives of employers and workers... number of representatives of workers shall not be less than the number of representatives of the employer.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the official order constituting the Safety Committee.
Step 2: Check the list of members.
Step 3: Verify that the number of worker representatives >= employer representatives.
Step 4: Check minutes of the last meeting to ensure it is active.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the document showing the list of Safety Committee members and minutes of the latest meeting.
capture_instructions.title: Safety Committee Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is 'Safety Committee Minutes' or 'Constitution Order'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract names of 'Employer Representatives' and 'Worker Representatives'. Count them. Verify Worker Count >= Employer Count.

question_text: Has the required number of Safety Officers been appointed?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Factories (>500 workers or >250 if hazardous), Construction (>250), Mines (>100).
legal_text: In every establishment which is a factory... mine... building or other construction work... the employer shall also appoint such number of safety officers, who shall possess such qualifications and perform such duties, as may be prescribed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Determine the total worker count.
Step 2: If above threshold, request the Appointment Letter of the Safety Officer(s).
Step 3: Verify the officer possesses the required technical qualifications.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the appointment letter of the Safety Officer.
capture_instructions.title: Safety Officer Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is an 'Appointment Letter' or 'CV'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Search for designation 'Safety Officer'. Extract 'Qualifications'. Verify presence of safety-related degree/diploma.

question_text: Are separate latrine and urinal accommodations provided for male, female, and transgender employees?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Sufficient arrangement for latrine and urinal accommodation to male, female and transgender employee separately and maintaining hygiene therein.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Visit the washroom facilities.
Step 2: Check for clear signage distinguishing 'Male', 'Female', and 'Transgender' (if applicable) toilets.
Step 3: Ensure privacy, water availability, and general hygiene.

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the washroom entrance showing the signage for separate facilities.
capture_instructions.title: Gender Separated Toilets

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if image shows 'Toilet' or 'Restroom' doors/signage.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Detect text/symbols for 'Men/Male', 'Women/Female', and 'Transgender/Unisex'. Flag if only one type is found.

question_text: Is potable drinking water provided at accessible points?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Potable drinking water [must be provided].

inspection_steps: Step 1: Locate the drinking water stations.
Step 2: Check if the water is clean and the area is hygienic (no waste water pooling).
Step 3: Look for 'Drinking Water' signage.
Step 4: Ask for the latest water testing report.

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the drinking water cooler/station marked with signage.
capture_instructions.title: Drinking Water Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if image shows a 'Water Cooler', 'RO Plant' or 'Dispenser'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Verify presence of 'Drinking Water' signage. Check for cleanliness of the area.

question_text: Is the workplace strictly free from accumulated waste and toxic effluents?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Ensure the disposal of hazardous and toxic waste including disposal of e-waste... Effective arrangements for treatment of wastes and effluents.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Inspect waste storage areas.
Step 2: Ensure hazardous waste is segregated and labeled.
Step 3: Verify there is no accumulation of e-waste or toxic leakage on the floors.

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the designated waste storage area showing segregation or bins.
capture_instructions.title: Waste Management Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if image shows 'Waste Bins', 'Disposal Yard' or 'Effluent Treatment Plant'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Detect labels like 'Hazardous', 'E-waste', or color-coded bins. Flag if waste is dumped openly.

question_text: Are lighting, ventilation, and temperature maintained at adequate standards?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Ventilation, temperature and humidity... Adequate lighting.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Walk through the darkest part of the facility.
Step 2: Ensure visibility is sufficient to work safely.
Step 3: Check if air circulation is adequate (fans, exhaust, AC) and temperature is bearable.
Step 4: Note any excessive dust or fumes.

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a wide-angle photo of the work floor showing lighting fixtures and ventilation (fans/ducts).
capture_instructions.title: Lighting & Ventilation Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if image shows an 'Interior Workspace'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Identify 'Lights', 'Windows', 'Fans', or 'Ventilation Ducts'. Flag if the image appears excessively dark.

question_text: Are adequate first-aid boxes with prescribed contents readily accessible during all working hours?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: The employer shall be responsible to provide and maintain... adequate first-aid boxes or cupboards with contents readily accessible during all working hours.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Locate the First Aid boxes on the shop floor or office area.
Step 2: Check if they are unlocked or the key is immediately available.
Step 3: Open a box and verify contents against the prescribed list (bandages, antiseptics, etc.).
Step 4: Ensure contents are not expired.

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the open First Aid box showing its contents and the location signage.
capture_instructions.title: First Aid Availability

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if image shows a 'First Aid Box' or medical supplies.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Identify items like 'Bandage', 'Cotton', 'Antiseptic'. Flag if the box appears empty or depleted.

question_text: Are separate and suitable washing facilities provided for male and female employees?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Adequate and suitable facilities for washing to male and female employees separately.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Inspect the washing area (sinks/taps).
Step 2: Verify separation for male and female employees (screens or separate rooms).
Step 3: Check for water supply and cleaning agents (soap).
Step 4: Ensure privacy is maintained.

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the washing area showing separate sections or entrances for men and women.
capture_instructions.title: Washing Facilities Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if image shows 'Sinks', 'Washbasins' or 'Bathing Area'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Look for gender signage (Male/Female) near the facilities. Confirm existence of water taps.

question_text: Are suitable sitting arrangements provided for employees obliged to work in a standing position?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments where work is primarily done standing.
legal_text: Sitting arrangements for all employees obliged to work in a standing position.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Identify areas where workers stand for long periods (e.g., assembly lines, retail counters).
Step 2: Check for stools, chairs, or benches provided nearby for rest intervals.
Step 3: Ensure the seating does not obstruct emergency exits.

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the work area showing the stools or chairs provided for standing workers.
capture_instructions.title: Seating Facility Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if image shows 'Chairs', 'Stools' or 'Benches' in a work environment.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Verify if seating is present near work stations.

question_text: Is a canteen provided and maintained if the establishment employs 100 or more workers?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments with 100 or more workers (including contract labour).
legal_text: Facilities of canteen in an establishment for employees thereof, wherein one hundred or more workers including contract labourers are ordinarily employed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Confirm total worker count (direct + contract). If <100, skip.
Step 2: Visit the canteen area.
Step 3: Check for hygiene, adequate seating, and food availability.
Step 4: Check if a Canteen Management Committee exists (optional but good practice).

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the canteen hall showing seating arrangements and the food counter.
capture_instructions.title: Canteen Facility Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if image shows a 'Cafeteria', 'Dining Hall' or 'Kitchen'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Verify presence of tables/chairs and food service area. Check for general cleanliness.

question_text: Is a creche facility provided (separately or commonly) if the establishment employs more than 50 workers?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments with more than 50 workers.
legal_text: Facility of creche having suitable room or rooms for the use of children under the age of six years... in establishments wherein more than fifty workers are ordinarily employed. Provided that an establishment can avail common creche facility...

inspection_steps: Step 1: Confirm worker count (>50).
Step 2: Visit the Creche facility.
Step 3: If on-site: Check for safety, ventilation, toys, and bedding.
Step 4: If off-site (common facility): Request proof of tie-up/agreement.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a photo of the Creche room (if on-site) or the Agreement with a common Creche provider.
capture_instructions.title: Creche Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if upload is a 'Room Photo' (toys/beds) or 'Legal Agreement'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: If Image: Look for 'Cribs', 'Toys', 'Kids'. If PDF: Search for 'Creche Services Agreement' and validity date.

question_text: Are separate shelters or rest-rooms provided for male, female, and transgender employees?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Factories and Mines (>50 workers) and Motor Transport Undertakings (night halts).
legal_text: Adequate, suitable and separate shelters or rest-rooms for male, female and transgender employees and lunch-room in every factory and mine wherein more than fifty workers are ordinarily employed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Locate the rest room or lunch room.
Step 2: Verify if it is separate from the workroom.
Step 3: Check for adequate seating and ventilation.
Step 4: Ensure gender separation is maintained.

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the rest room or lunch room showing seating and gender separation signage.
capture_instructions.title: Rest Room Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if image shows a 'Break Room' or 'Lunch Room'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Verify presence of tables/chairs. Check for 'Rest Room' or 'Lunch Room' signage.

question_text: Has a Welfare Officer been appointed (if applicable)?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Factories, Mines, Plantations with 250 or more workers.
legal_text: The appointment of welfare officer in every factory, mine or plantation wherein two hundred and fifty or more workers are ordinarily employed and the qualification, conditions of service and duties...

inspection_steps: Step 1: Check worker count (>250).
Step 2: Request the Appointment Letter of the Welfare Officer.
Step 3: Verify the designation matches 'Welfare Officer'.
Step 4: Check if qualifications (e.g., Social Work degree) are mentioned.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the appointment letter or joining report of the designated Welfare Officer.
capture_instructions.title: Welfare Officer Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is an 'Appointment Letter' or 'CV'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Designation'. Verify it contains 'Welfare Officer'. Check for educational qualifications.

question_text: Is annual leave with wages calculated correctly (1 day for every 20 days worked) for eligible workers?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments. (Note: rate is 1:15 for mines and adolescents).
legal_text: He shall be entitled for one-day leave for every twenty days of his work, in the case of adolescent worker for fifteen days of his work, and in case of worker employed below ground mine, at the rate of one day for every fifteen days of his work.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the Register of Adult Workers / Leave with Wages Register (Form 15 or equivalent).
Step 2: Select a sample worker who worked >180 days last year.
Step 3: Calculate 'Days Worked' divided by 20.
Step 4: Verify this matches the 'Leave Credited' column.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a page of the Leave Register showing 'Days Worked' and 'Leave Earned/Credited' columns.
capture_instructions.title: Leave Calculation Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Leave Register' or 'Leave Card'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Days Worked' and 'Leave Credited'. Calculate Expected Leave = Days Worked / 20. Flag mismatch if Credited < Expected.

question_text: Is the carry-forward of unavailed annual leave capped at 30 days, with excess leave being encashed?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: The total number of days of leave that may be carried forward to a succeeding year shall not exceed thirty days... such worker shall be entitled... to encash such exceeded leave.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Review the Leave Register for year-end balances.
Step 2: Check the 'Closing Balance' carried to next year.
Step 3: Ensure it does not exceed 30 days.
Step 4: Verify that any balance >30 days was paid out (encashed).

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the Leave Register showing closing balances at the end of the calendar year.
capture_instructions.title: Leave Carry Forward Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Leave Register'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Closing Balance'. If > 30, check for indication of 'Encashment' or 'Payment' for the excess.

question_text: Are wages in lieu of unavailed leave paid within two working days to employees who quit or are dismissed?
applicability_criteria: Applicable when an employee is discharged, dismissed, or quits.
legal_text: Where such worker is discharged or dismissed or quits employment before the expiry of the second working day from the date of such discharge, dismissal or quitting... shall be entitled to wages in lieu of the quantum of leave.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Identify an employee who left in the last 6 months.
Step 2: Request their 'Full and Final Settlement' (FnF) statement.
Step 3: Compare 'Date of Leaving' with 'Date of Payment'.
Step 4: Verify the payment includes 'Leave Encashment'.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the FnF statement or bank proof of payment for a recently exited employee.
capture_instructions.title: Exit Payment Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Settlement Receipt' or 'FnF Statement'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Date of Exit' and 'Date of Payment'. Verify Payment Date <= Exit Date + 2 days.

question_text: Are workers entitled to wages for the leave period at a rate equal to their daily average earnings?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: For the purpose of equal wages... the emoluments specified in sub-clauses (d), (f), (g) and (h) shall be taken for computation of wages. [Refers to standard calculation of leave wages].

inspection_steps: Step 1: Check a wage slip where 'Leave Wages' were paid.
Step 2: Verify the rate used.
Step 3: Ensure it includes basic wages + DA (and other applicable allowances) averaged over the full-time work period.
Step 4: It should not be just 'Basic' if DA is applicable.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a wage slip for a month where a worker took annual leave.
capture_instructions.title: Leave Wage Rate Check

question_text: Does every contractor engaged by the establishment hold a valid license issued by the designated authority?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments engaging 50 or more contract labourers (or as notified).
legal_text: No contractor to whom this Part applies shall supply or engage contract labour in any establishment... except under and in accordance with a licence issued to him by the authority.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Get the list of all active contractors.
Step 2: Request the valid Labour License for each contractor.
Step 3: Check if the license is valid for the current period and the number of workers deployed does not exceed the license limit.

question_text: Are wages disbursed to contract labour via bank transfer within the prescribed period?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all contractors.
legal_text: Every contractor shall, make the disbursement of wages... through bank transfer or electronic mode and inform the principal employer electronically the amount so paid.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the 'Wage Disbursement Record' for the last month from the contractor.
Step 2: Verify proof of bank transfer (e.g., bank advice slip).
Step 3: Ensure the Principal Employer has received electronic intimation of this payment.

question_text: Has the contractor intimated the work order to the designated authority?
applicability_criteria: Applicable whenever a new work order is issued to a contractor.
legal_text: When a contractor receives work order... he shall, within such time and in such manner as may be prescribed, intimate to the authority.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Select a recent work order issued to a contractor.
Step 2: Ask for the 'Form of Intimation' receipt submitted to the Labour Department.
Step 3: Verify the details match the work order.

question_text: Is the lump sum journey allowance paid to inter-State migrant workers annually?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments employing Inter-State Migrant Workers.
legal_text: The employer shall pay, to every inter-State migrant worker employed in his establishment, in a year a lump sum amount of fare for to and fro journey to his native place.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Identify Inter-State Migrant Workers from the register.
Step 2: Check payroll or voucher records for 'Journey Allowance' or 'Travel Fare'.
Step 3: Confirm it covers to and fro journey costs.

ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Search for 'Journey Allowance', 'Travel Fare', or 'Lump Sum'. Verify amounts are credited to worker accounts.

question_text: Does the contractor issue Experience Certificates to contract labour?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all contractors.
legal_text: Every concerned contractor shall issue, on demand, experience certificate, in such form as may be prescribed... giving details of the work performed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Ask for a copy of a recently issued Experience Certificate.
Step 2: Ensure it contains the period of work and nature of duties.
Step 3: If no recent exits, check the format used for issuance.

question_text: Is the toll-free helpline facility provided/displayed for inter-State migrant workers?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments employing Inter-State Migrant Workers.
legal_text: The appropriate Government may provide facility of toll free helpline... [Employer compliance implied to display/facilitate access].

inspection_steps: Step 1: Look for notices in areas frequented by migrant workers.
Step 2: Check if the Toll-Free Helpline number prescribed by the state is displayed.
Step 3: Verify visibility and language (local/native language of workers).

question_text: Is the employment of women during night shifts (7 PM - 6 AM) subject to their consent and safety conditions?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments employing women during night hours.
legal_text: Women shall be entitled to be employed in all establishments for all types of work under this Code and they may also be employed, with their consent before 6 a.m. and beyond 7 p.m. subject to such conditions relating to safety, holidays and working hours or any other condition... as may be prescribed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Check the shift roster for women employees working between 7 PM and 6 AM.
Step 2: If found, request the 'Consent Form' signed by the employee.
Step 3: Verify proof of safe transport provided by the employer (transport log/contract).

capture_instructions.title: Night Shift Consent & Safety

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Consent Form' or 'Transport Log'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Search for keywords 'Consent', 'Night Shift', '7 PM', '6 AM'. Verify signatures. Check for 'Transport' provision clause.

question_text: Are adequate safeguards provided prior to employing women in dangerous operations?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments with notified dangerous operations/hazardous processes.
legal_text: Where the appropriate Government considers that the employment of women is dangerous for their health and safety... [it may] require the employer to provide adequate safeguards prior to the employment of women for such operation.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Identify hazardous areas (e.g., chemical mixing, heavy machinery).
Step 2: Check if women are deployed there.
Step 3: If yes, inspect for special safeguards (e.g., specific PPE, automated handling, barriers) as per state rules.
Step 4: Verify training records specific to those hazards.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload training records or a photo of the specific safeguard equipment used by women in hazardous areas.
capture_instructions.title: Dangerous Operation Safeguards

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if upload is a 'Training Record' or 'Equipment Photo'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: If Document: Look for 'Hazardous Process Training', 'Women Employees'. If Image: Detect PPE or Safety Guards.

question_text: Is the employment of persons below 18 years prohibited in mines (except apprentices >16)?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Mines.
legal_text: No person below eighteen years of age shall be allowed to work in any mine or part thereof. Notwithstanding... apprentices and other trainees, not below sixteen years of age, may be allowed to work, under proper supervision.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the 'Register of Persons Employed'.
Step 2: Check the 'Date of Birth' column for all employees.
Step 3: If any age < 18 is found, verify they are registered Apprentices/Trainees > 16.
Step 4: Check for medical fitness certificates for these trainees.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the page of the register showing Age/DOB or a Medical Certificate for apprentices.
capture_instructions.title: Age Verification (Mines)

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is an 'Employee Register' or 'Medical Certificate'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Date of Birth'. Calculate Age. Flag if Age < 18 unless 'Apprentice' is mentioned.

question_text: Are persons with defective vision, deafness, or giddiness excluded from risky building/construction work?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Building & Other Construction Work.
legal_text: No person, about whom the employer knows or has reasons to believe that he is a deaf or he has a defective vision or he has a tendency to giddiness, shall be required or allowed to work in any such operation of building or other construction work which is likely to involve a risk of any accident.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Check the 'Medical Examination Records' for workers at heights or operating cranes.
Step 2: Verify that fitness certificates explicitly rule out 'Vertigo', 'Deafness', or 'Vision defects'.
Step 3: Ensure records are updated periodically.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a medical fitness certificate for a worker engaged in height work or heavy machinery operation.
capture_instructions.title: Fitness for Risky Work

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Medical Fitness Certificate'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Scan for 'Fit for Height Work', 'Vision Normal', 'Hearing Normal'. Flag if 'Unfit' or specific conditions like 'Vertigo' are noted.

question_text: Is the age of workers verified using Aadhaar or valid birth certificates?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments employing young persons.
legal_text: The medical authority... shall, while examining a worker for issuing the certificate of age... take into account the Aadhaar card of the worker, and in the absence thereof, the date of birth certificate from school... or birth certificate.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Review the personnel files of young workers.
Step 2: Check if Age Proof copies (Aadhaar/School Certificate) are attached.
Step 3: Verify the age recorded in the register matches the proof.

ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Date of Birth'. Cross-reference with the worker category (Adult/Adolescent).

question_text: Has the occupier disclosed all information regarding dangers and health hazards to the workers, Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator, and local authority?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factories involving hazardous processes (First Schedule).
legal_text: The occupier of every factory involving a hazardous process shall disclose in the manner prescribed... all information regarding dangers, including health hazards and the measures to overcome such hazards... to the workers employed in the factory, the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator... and the general public.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Check for the 'Disclosure of Information' document (often Form 11 or similar state specific form).
Step 2: Verify proof of submission to the Chief Inspector and Local Authority.
Step 3: Check if this information is displayed or communicated to workers (e.g., MSDS sheets available).

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the disclosure form submitted to the authorities regarding hazardous processes.
capture_instructions.title: Hazard Disclosure Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Hazard Disclosure Form', 'MSDS Compilation', or 'Safety Report'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Verify if the document lists 'Hazardous Materials', 'Health Risks', and 'Safety Measures'. Check for 'Received' stamp from authority.

question_text: Is there an approved On-Site Emergency Plan and Disaster Control Measure in place?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factories involving hazardous processes.
legal_text: Every occupier shall, with the approval of the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator, draw up an on-site emergency plan and detailed disaster control measures for his factory and make known to the workers... the safety measures required to be taken.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the 'On-Site Emergency Plan'.
Step 2: Check for the approval signature/seal of the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator.
Step 3: Verify the plan includes evacuation routes and disaster control protocols.
Step 4: Check if the last mock drill record is attached.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the cover page and approval page of the On-Site Emergency Plan.
capture_instructions.title: Emergency Plan Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is an 'Emergency Plan' or 'Disaster Control Plan'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Search for 'Approved by Chief Inspector' or official seal. Verify the date is current/valid.

question_text: Are accurate and up-to-date health/medical records maintained for workers exposed to hazardous substances?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factories involving hazardous processes.
legal_text: Maintain accurate and up-to-date health records or, as the case may be, medical records, of the workers in the factory who are exposed to any chemical, toxic or any other harmful substances... and such records shall be accessible to the workers.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Identify workers in the hazardous zone.
Step 2: Request the 'Health Register' (Form 16/17 equivalent).
Step 3: Check for entries of pre-employment and periodic medical exams.
Step 4: Ensure the Fitness Certificate (Form O) is attached.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a page of the Health Register showing recent medical examination entries for exposed workers.

question_text: Are supervisors handling hazardous substances qualified and competent?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factories involving hazardous processes.
legal_text: Appoint persons who possess prescribed qualifications and experience in handling hazardous substances and are competent to supervise such handling within the factory.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the list of supervisors in the hazardous process department.
Step 2: Check their qualification certificates (Chemistry/Chemical Engineering/Safety Diploma).
Step 3: Verify experience letters proving competence in hazardous handling.

ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Search for keywords like 'Chemical Engineering', 'Industrial Safety', 'Chemistry'. Verify relevant experience.

question_text: Are permissible limits of exposure to chemical and toxic substances adhered to?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factories using chemicals/toxic substances.
legal_text: The maximum permissible limits of exposure of chemical and toxic substances in manufacturing process in any factory shall be of the value as may be prescribed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the latest 'Workplace Environment Monitoring Report' (Air/Chemical Analysis).
Step 2: Check the 'Measured Value' vs 'Permissible Limit' (TLV/STEL) columns.
Step 3: Ensure the report is from an accredited lab and is recent (usually annual/bi-annual).

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Monitoring Report' or 'Lab Analysis Report'.

question_text: In plantations, are insecticides and toxic substances handled only by trained workers under supervision?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Plantations.
legal_text: Appoint persons possessing the prescribed qualifications to supervise the use... of insecticides... Ensure that every worker... is trained about the hazards involved.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Visit the chemical mixing/storage area.
Step 2: Interview a worker handling sprayers.
Step 3: Ask if they received training on hazards.
Step 4: Check for the presence of a qualified supervisor.
Step 5: Verify separate washing facilities for these workers.

question_text: Are safety measures for handling hazardous substances publicized among workers and the general public?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factories involving hazardous processes.
legal_text: Lay down measures for the handling, usage, transportation and storage of hazardous substances... and publicise them in the manner prescribed... among the workers and the general public living in the vicinity.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Check notice boards near the factory gate (for public).
Step 2: Check for safety posters/instructions near the hazardous process area.
Step 3: Verify if 'Do's and Don'ts' are displayed in the local language.

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if image shows a 'Safety Notice' or 'Hazard Sign'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Detect text related to 'Emergency', 'Hazard', 'Safety Instructions'. Verify visibility.

question_text: Is the Master Register (Employee Register) maintained electronically or physically with all prescribed particulars?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Maintain register in prescribed form, electronically or otherwise, containing such particulars of workers... including work performed, number of hours... day of rest... wage paid... leave... overtime... and employment of adolescent.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the 'Employee Register' (often Form A or combined Master Register).
Step 2: Check if it contains columns for Name, Designation, Wages, Leave, and Overtime.
Step 3: Verify that entries are current (up to the last working day/month).

ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Check for presence of headers: 'Name', 'Designation', 'Wages', 'Attendance'. Confirm data exists for the current/previous month.

question_text: Has the Annual Unified Return been filed electronically with the Inspector-cum-Facilitator?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: File such return electronically or otherwise to the Inspector-cum-Facilitator in such manner and during such periods as may be prescribed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Ask for the acknowledgement of the last Annual Return filed.
Step 2: Verify the filing date (usually by Feb 1st of the following year).
Step 3: Ensure it covers the correct financial/calendar year.

ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Filing Date' and 'Period Covered'. Verify if the filing was done within the prescribed deadline (e.g., before Feb 1st).

question_text: Are wage slips issued to all workers (electronically or physically) at least a day prior to disbursement?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Issue wage slips to the workers, in electronic forms or otherwise.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Interview 2-3 workers randomly.
Step 2: Ask if they receive a wage slip (payslip) every month.
Step 3: Request a sample copy of a recent wage slip.
Step 4: Verify it details gross wages, deductions, and net pay.

ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Verify presence of 'Employer Name', 'Employee Name', 'Earnings', 'Deductions', and 'Net Pay'.

question_text: Are the Abstract of the Code and other required notices displayed at a conspicuous place?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Display notices at the work place of the workers in such manner and form as may be prescribed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Go to the main entrance or time-office.
Step 2: Check for the 'Abstract of the OSH Code'.
Step 3: Check for the list of holidays and wage period notice.
Step 4: Ensure they are in English and the local language.

question_text: Are records maintained truthfully without falsification or unauthorized alteration?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Punishment for falsification of records... produces false records or counterfeits or knowingly makes... a false statement.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Cross-check Attendance Register entries with Biometric/Gate logs for a specific day.
Step 2: Cross-check OT Register hours with production logs.
Step 3: Look for obvious overwriting or white-fluid usage on physical registers without initialing.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a photo where a register entry contradicts another source (only if discrepancy found), otherwise upload a clean register page.

question_text: Has the employer submitted a notice to the appropriate authority for any accident causing death or bodily injury preventing work for 48 hours or more?
applicability_criteria: Applicable if any reportable accident occurred in the audit period.
legal_text: Where at any place in an establishment, an accident occurs which causes death, or which causes any bodily injury by reason of which the person injured is prevented from working for a period of forty-eight hours or more... employer... shall send notice thereof to such authorities... within such time, as may be prescribed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Check the 'Accident Register' or 'Incident Log' for the past year.
Step 2: Identify entries where 'Days Lost' >= 2 days (48 hours) or 'Fatal' is marked.
Step 3: For each such event, request the proof of notice (Form) sent to the Inspector-cum-Facilitator.
Step 4: Verify the notice date is within the prescribed limit (typically 4-24 hours depending on state rules).

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the copy of the Accident Notice (e.g., Form 18 or equivalent) submitted to authorities for the most recent reportable accident.

ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Date of Accident' and 'Date of Report'. Check if 'Nature of Injury' indicates 'Fatal' or 'Disablement'. Verify submission timeframe.

question_text: Have 'Dangerous Occurrences' (fires, explosions, collapse) been reported even if no bodily injury was caused?
applicability_criteria: Applicable if a dangerous occurrence (as defined in rules) occurred.
legal_text: Where in an establishment there is any dangerous occurrence of such nature, (whether causing any bodily injury or disability, or not) the employer shall send notice thereof to such authorities, and in such form and within such time, as may be prescribed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Ask the Safety Officer if any fire, structural collapse, or machinery explosion occurred recently.
Step 2: Check the Safety Logbook.
Step 3: If yes, request the specific 'Notice of Dangerous Occurrence' submitted to the authorities.
Step 4: Ensure reporting was done even if no one was hurt.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the notice submitted for any recent dangerous occurrence (fire/explosion/collapse).

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Notice of Dangerous Occurrence' or 'Incident Report'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Search for keywords 'Fire', 'Explosion', 'Collapse'. Verify the document is addressed to the Inspector-cum-Facilitator.

question_text: Has the employer notified the authorities of any worker contracting a disease specified in the Third Schedule (e.g., Silicosis, Lead Poisoning)?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments with specific hazards (chemical/dust/noise).
legal_text: Where any worker in an establishment contracts any disease specified in the Third Schedule, the employer of the establishment shall send notice thereof to such authorities, and in such form and within such time, as may be prescribed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Review the Annual Health Examination records.
Step 2: Look for diagnosis of Third Schedule diseases (e.g., Asbestosis, Noise Induced Hearing Loss, Toxic Jaundice).
Step 3: If found, ask for the 'Notice of Occupational Disease' sent to the Chief Inspector.
Step 4: Cross-reference with the list in the Third Schedule.

question_text: Is a bound Register of Accidents and Dangerous Occurrences maintained?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Maintain register in prescribed form... containing such particulars of workers... including... dangerous occurrences.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the 'Register of Accidents'.
Step 2: Verify it contains columns for: Date, Time, Nature of Accident, Person Injured, and Action Taken.
Step 3: Check if it is signed by the Manager.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the last used page of the Accident Register (or a blank page if no accidents occurred).

ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Verify columns for 'Name of Injured', 'Date of Accident', 'Nature of Injury'. Check for Manager's signature.

question_text: Is a written agreement entered into with every audio-visual worker and registered with the competent authority?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to producers of audio-visual programmes (films, web series, TV, etc.).
legal_text: No person shall be employed as an audio-visual worker... unless an agreement in writing is entered into... and such agreement is registered with the competent authority... by the producer.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Select 3 random audio-visual workers (actors, stunt persons, technicians).
Step 2: Request their 'Employment Agreement'.
Step 3: Check if the agreement covers wages, hours, and safety.
Step 4: Verify proof of registration of this agreement with the notified authority.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the written agreement for a worker, stamped/acknowledged by the competent authority.

question_text: Has a sole manager with prescribed qualifications been appointed for the mine?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Mines.
legal_text: Every mine shall be under a sole manager who shall have such qualifications as may be prescribed... and the owner or agent of every mine shall appoint a person... to be the manager.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the Appointment Letter of the Mine Manager.
Step 2: Request the 'Certificate of Competency' (e.g., First Class Manager's Certificate from DGMS).
Step 3: Verify the manager is solely responsible for this mine (unless exempted).

question_text: Are vocational training and rescue services established and maintained for mine workers?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Mines.
legal_text: The Central Government may prescribe vocational training and rescue and recovery services for persons employed in a mine.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Visit the Vocational Training Centre (VTC) on site.
Step 2: Check training records/registers for new inductees.
Step 3: Inspect the Rescue Station/Room for breathing apparatus and rescue equipment.
Step 4: Verify the rescue team roster.

ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Identify safety equipment or training infrastructure. Flag if room appears empty or defunct.

question_text: Is the industrial premises for beedi/cigar work licensed separately?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Beedi and Cigar industrial premises.
legal_text: No employer shall use or allow to use any place or premises as an industrial premises unless he holds a valid licence issued... for the purposes of this Part.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the specific License for 'Industrial Premises' under the Beedi & Cigar Part.
Step 2: Check the validity date (typically 5 years/renewable).
Step 3: Ensure the plan of the premises attached matches the actual site.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the valid license for the industrial premises used for beedi/cigar manufacturing.
capture_instructions.title: Premises License Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'License' or 'Permit'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Search for keywords 'Beedi', 'Cigar', 'Industrial Premises'. Extract 'Valid Till' date.

question_text: Is a record maintained of work permitted to be carried on outside the industrial premises (home workers)?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Beedi/Cigar establishments with home workers.
legal_text: The employer shall maintain the record of the work permitted... to be carried on outside the industrial premises, in such form as may be prescribed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Ask if workers are allowed to cut leaves/wet beedis at home.
Step 2: If yes, request the 'Record of Outside Work' (often Form IV or equivalent).
Step 3: Check entries for raw material issued and finished goods received.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the register showing details of work distributed to home workers.
capture_instructions.title: Home Work Record Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is a 'Work Register' or 'Log'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Verify columns for 'Material Issued', 'Worker Name', 'Work Returned'. Check dates for consistency.

question_text: Is necessary housing accommodation provided to every resident worker and their family in the plantation?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Plantations.
legal_text: Every employer to make provisions in his plantation for necessary housing accommodation including drinking water, kitchen and toilet to every worker employed in the plantation (including his family).

inspection_steps: Step 1: Visit the labour colony/housing area.
Step 2: Inspect a sample house.
Step 3: Check for basic amenities: Kitchen, Toilet, Drinking Water, and structural safety (roof/walls).
Step 4: Verify it is provided free or at standard rates.

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the worker housing showing the structure and toilet facilities.
capture_instructions.title: Housing Facility Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if image shows 'Houses', 'Quarters', or 'Residential Units'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Detect 'Building Structure'. Flag if it appears dilapidated or lacks 'Toilet' structures visible outside.
